alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 06 at 4:46AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SOUTH OF NINILCHIK THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... Bands of moderate to heavy snow have developed from southern Cook Inlet to Homer and Seldovia this morning in the wake of an area of low pressure moving north across the Kenai Peninsula. As of 4am AKST, the heaviest snow band is situated over Seldovia with light to moderate snow falling over Homer. These bands of snow will slowly lift across Kachemak Bay through the early morning hours, with heavier snow at times overspreading Homer and the Homer Bluffs. Gusty southwesterly winds are expected to develop early this morning and may lead to periods of blowing snow across the Homer Bluffs through Monday morning. The heavier snow is expected to taper off along the immediate coast later this morning, limiting snow amounts for Homer and Seldovia. However, snow is expected to linger across the Homer Bluffs through Monday afternoon. Snow totals of 2 to 4 inches are possible along the Kachemak Bay coast, with upwards of 6 inches possible for areas along the Homer Bluffs.
